intro: Haloragis ceratophylla, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of small, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is evergreen, with leaves that are typically blue-green in color and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Haloragis ceratophylla is a popular ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
